title: Voice of the Mirror: Bosses who rip off low-paid workers should face court and heavy fines
text:
Debenhams was among the firms named and shamed (Photo: Getty) Share Get politics   Thank you for subscribing!   
Bosses who rip off low-paid workers should be in the dock and clobbered with hefty fines. 
Naming and shaming 360 companies who cheated 15,520 employees of even the legal minimum wage is good as far as it goes. 
So, too, is ensuring the robbed £995,233 was put into the workers’ pay packets, and the firms were stung almost as much by HMRC’s £800,000 penalties as they were by the shaming publicity. 
But imagine if workers had cheated bosses, helping themselves to nearly £1million they weren’t entitled to. It’s a fair bet we’d see sackings and prosecutions, the offenders finding themselves out of jobs and up before the magistrates. 
Throwing the book at bosses caught breaking the law by failing to pay the legal minimum would soon have others behaving better. 
Administrative errors by companies are mistakes the low-paid are unable to see the funny side of. And if employers take great care not to overpay, let’s stop them underpaying. Like us on Facebook
